Microsoft.DataMigration/services/projects/tasks

___etag.description: HTTP strong entity tag value. This is ignored if submitted.
HTTP strong entity tag value. Ignored if submitted

$eref.description: Properties of the Data Migration service instance

___virtualSubnetId.description: The ID of the Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/subnets resource to which the service should be joined

$eref.description: An Azure SKU instance

___name.description: The unique name of the SKU, such as 'P3'

___capacity.description: The capacity of the SKU, if it supports scaling

___size.description: The size of the SKU, used when the name alone does not denote a service size or when a SKU has multiple performance classes within a family, e.g. 'A1' for virtual machines

___tier.description: The tier of the SKU, such as 'Free', 'Basic', 'Standard', or 'Premium'

___family.description: The SKU family, used when the service has multiple performance classes within a tier, such as 'A', 'D', etc. for virtual machines

___kind.description: The resource kind. Only 'vm' (the default) is supported.

$eref.description: Microsoft.DataMigration/services/projects

___etag.description: HTTP strong entity tag value. This is ignored if submitted.

$eref.description: Base class for all types of DMS task properties. If task is not supported by current client, this object is returned.

_88MigrationValidationOptions.description: Types of validations to run after the migration

___enableDataIntegrityValidation.description: Allows to perform a checksum based data integrity validation between source and target for the selected database / tables .

___enableQueryAnalysisValidation.description: Allows to perform a quick and intelligent query analysis by retrieving queries from the source database and executes them in the target. The result will have execution statistics for executions in source and target databases for the extracted queries.

___enableSchemaValidation.description: Allows to compare the schema information between source and target.

___connectionMode.description: Connection mode to be used. If ConnectionString mode is used, then customConnectionString should be provided, else it should not be set.

___trustServerCertificate.description: Whether to trust the server certificate

___authentication.description: Authentication type to use for connection.

___backupSharePassword.description: Password credential used to connect to the backup share location. It must be RSA encrypted by the public key of the VM, then base64 encoded. It must never be the plaintext! Cryptography class contains helper methods to perform the encryption.

_88MigrateSqlServerSqlDbTaskProperties.description: Properties for the task that migrates on-prem SQL Server databases to Azure SQL Database

$eref.description: Input for the task that migrates on-prem SQL Server databases to Azure SQL Database

___validationOptions.description:
Options for enabling various post migration validations. Available options, 
 1.) Data Integrity Check: Performs a checksum based comparison on source and target tables after the migration to ensure the correctness of the data. 
 2.) Schema Validation: Performs a thorough schema comparison between the source and target tables and provides a list of differences between the source and target database, 3.) Query Analysis: Executes a set of queries picked up automatically either from the Query Plan Cache or Query Store and execute them and compares the execution time between the source and target database.

___selectedTables.description: Metadata of the tables selected for migration

$eref.description: Types of validations to run after the migration

___enableDataIntegrityValidation.description: Allows to perform a checksum based data integrity validation between source and target for the selected database / tables .

___enableQueryAnalysisValidation.description: Allows to perform a quick and intelligent query analysis by retrieving queries from the source database and executes them in the target. The result will have execution statistics for executions in source and target databases for the extracted queries.

___enableSchemaValidation.description: Allows to compare the schema information between source and target.

___validationOptions.description:
Options for enabling various post migration validations. Available options, 
 1.) Data Integrity Check: Performs a checksum based comparison on source and target tables after the migration to ensure the correctness of the data. 
 2.) Schema Validation: Performs a thorough schema comparison between the source and target tables and provides a list of differences between the source and target database, 3.) Query Analysis: Executes a set of queries picked up automatically either from the Query Plan Cache or Query Store and execute them and compares the execution time between the source and target database.
